Alchemilla.description: Alchemilla is a genus of herbaceous perennial commonly known as lady's mantle. It forms dense, leafy mounds of scallop-edged, toothed green leaves, which have valuable application in creating stronger medicines.

Alil.description: Alil is a small, fountain-like, semi-evergreen shrub that grows up to 3 feet tall. It has small blue flowers that bloom irregularly, typically in late winter and early spring.

Angel skin.description: Angel skin is a tiny delicate mushroom that grows underground and in other cool dark places. It is characterized by multiple thin stalks and gills of pure white that emit a faint bioluminescent glow.

Arctic root.description: Arctic root is a succulent, perennial flowering plant that grows in cold, high-altitude regions. It is also known as rhodiola rosea, golden root, king's crown, and roseroot.

Bittergrass.description: Bittergrass is a species of flowering plant in the aster family also known as calea or dream herb. It has a long history as a psychedelic, and is smoked or brewed and drunk as tea to induce lucid dreams.

Blodgrass.description: Bloodgrass is a copper-colored grass with traditional use in Orcish battle culture, whereby it is dried and ground to produce a deep crimson warpaint, allowing for absorption quickly through the skin.

Bloodpurge.description: Bloodpurge is a bulbous flowering plant in the genus allium, and is a close relative of garlic. It is easily identified by its purple stems, which can grow up to 1 foot tall.

Blue lotus flower.description: The blue lotus is a rare species of freshwater lily native to temperate and tropical climates. Seeing a blue lotus in bloom is believed by some to bring good fortune.

Darkberry.description: The darkberry is a bramble fruit with thick thorny vines that grows in deep shaded forest. The dark, berry-like fruits grow inside large blue flowers that bloom only under a new moon.

Deadly nightshade.description: Also known as belladonna, nightshade is a toxic perennial plant most often found in scrub and woodland identified by its small violet flowers. Though highly poisonous, its small dark berries have strong medicinal properties when properly handled.

Desert aloe.description: Desert aloe is a succulent evergreen perennial that grows in arid and tropical climates. It has thick, fleshy green leaves with serrated edges that contain a clear gel, which can be used in its raw form to treat minor burns.

Dragonwort.description: Dragonwort is a species of aroid flowering plant that grows up to 3' tall and has large, dark green leaves streaked with white, and a spadix that resembles a dragon's claw.

Ephedra.description: Ephedra is a genus of gymnosperm low evergreen shrub with small scaly leaves that grows in any environment with sun exposure.

Fairy bells.description: Fairy bells are the small white flowers that grow on a small, leafy shrub commonly found in grassy terrain, and are particularly common around battle sites and graveyards.

Fleshwort.description: Fleshwort is a common ivy used to treat injury and fatigue. Its leaves are used to create many types of poultice or medicine (often mixed with other plants) that have a variety of healing effects.

Flintmoss.description: This rust-colored moss grows near freshwater in caves and shaded riverbanks. Its large oily leaves burn bright and hot.

Glowshroom.description: The glowshroom is a common underground mushroom known for its remarkably strong bio-luminescence. It typically grows in large clusters that can light up even the largest underground caves.

Juniper berries.description: Juniper berries, found on juniper shrubs and trees, are small blue seed cones with an unusually fleshy and merged scales, which gives them their berry-like appearance.

Kava root.description: Kava is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15' tall with heart-shaped glossy dark green leaves. Its roots have been used for centuries to brew tea that relieves anxiety and stress.

Knitbone.description: Knitbone, also called comfrey, is a perennial plant with small purple flowers that grows around swamps and in other moist grasslands. It has a long history of use as a medicinal herb for topical and internal injuries.

Lunar holly berries.description: Lunar holly grows in temperate and subtropical regions, particularly in forested areas. It flowers while the moon is full, producing tiny speckled blue-white berries.

Maiden's tear.description: The maiden's tear is a flowering vine that only grows on trees overhanging still or slow-moving water. In full bloom, the flowers have three large petals of white-streaked violet which possess remarkable magical properties.

Mistletoe.description: Mistletoe is a parasitic plant that attaches itself to a host tree, from which it draws water and nutrition. It has smooth-edged green leaves borne in pairs along a woody stem, and waxy, white berries.

Red lichen.description: Red lichen is recognizable by its striking red podetia, which grow up to 1 inch tall with purple caps. This lichen tends to grow on rotting wood near riverbanks and other water sources.

Red mountain flower.description: Red mountain flowers, also called skeggel, are a short-lived perennial wildflower found in mountain regions known for their brilliant red color and ability to restore magic to an exhausted mage.

Sabito seeds.description: The sabito is a vining plant with large fleshy fruit, which is a berry with a hard rind similar to a watermelon. The fruit appears similar to a watermelon, and is edible, though slightly bitter and unpleasant.

Sand palm seeds.description: The sand palm is a small slender palm that grows up to 20 feet tall with fan-shaped leaves. The oils in sand palm seeds are used to make a topical balm that protects from long exposure to the sun.

Silverleaf sap.description: The silverleaf is a medium-sized deciduous tree that grows in forests in cold climates. Although its bark is tough, its sap can be extracted, and has popular use among big game hunters.

Sweet elorien.description: Sweet elorien is a flowering plant that produces a short stem and a daisy-like flower, commonly found at high elevation. It is named in memory of Iorien's first daughter, who died at a young age.

White magnolia.description: The white magnolia, also called little gem, is a plant that flowers a single bloom. It prefers dry soil, and only flowers at night under a clear sky.

Willow bark.description: Willow trees are a common type of tree found in all environments, but prefer moist soil and a temperate climate. Bark from a mature willow tree contains salicin, which numbs or reduces the pain sensations.

Witch hazel.description: Witch hazel is a genus of flowering deciduous bush or small tree that grows in damp woods and shaded grassy areas that can grow up to 6 meters tall. A potent healing salve can be made from its bark and leaves.

Wizard's fingers.description: Wizard's fingers is a species of fungus in the family hypocreaceae that resemble fleshy red carrots sprouting up from the ground. The fingers are highly toxic without proper preparation, and are responsible for dozens of fatalities every year.

Fiends.name: Devil blood
Fiends.use: Devil's Sight, Tincture of Magic Resistance

Undead.name: Grave dust
Undead.use: Wight Powder, Draught of the Living Dead

Undead.name: Ectoplasm
Undead.use: Banshee, Draught of the Living Dead

sizeAmounts.description: Δ (delta) amounts depend on creature size

harvestingRules.target: Creature must be dead or incapacitated for the duration
harvestingRules.resolution: Make a harvesting check using your harvesting kit
harvestingRules.advantage: If you (or a helper) is proficient in the skill associated with the target's creature type
harvestingRules.favoredEnemy: +2 if you (or a helper) has Favored Enemy and the target matches
harvestingRules.dcNote: DC X/+5 means DC X for the first unit, +5 per additional unit

amountRules.fixed: Components with a fixed number (×1 or ×2) have that exact amount available
amountRules.delta: Components marked with Δ depend on creature size: Medium or smaller = 1, Large = 2, Huge = 4, Gargantuan+ = 8
amountRules.dcScaling: For components with more than one unit, DC increases by +5 for each unit after the first
amountRules.example: A Huge frost giant has 4 units of giant heartsblood (DC 10/+5): DC 10 for 1 unit, DC 15 for 2, DC 20 for 3, DC 25 for all 4
amountRules.failure: Any components you fail to harvest are lost—you cannot retry for fewer units
